alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 7:32AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Choctaw, Monroe, northern Washington, central Clarke and central Conecuh Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 731 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Saint Stephens, or 11 miles northwest of Jackson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Jackson, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Peterman, Saint Stephens, Leroy, Whatley, Millry, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Coffeeville, Repton and I65 And US 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
